title: Bug 102436 - Date/time value not stored correctly in report design
description: Bug 102436 - Date/time value not stored correctly in report design. An invalid date/time string (which does not conform to a universal format or the system default locale format) should have been rejected.
OB: When creating a new 'DateTime' type report parameter in the BIRT report designer and entering an invalid date string ('55/66/9999') in the 'default value' field, the invalid value is accepted. The report design then shows the following definition: <parameters><scalar parameter name='dateParam1'><property name='dataType' value='dateTime'/><property name='allowBlank' value='false'/><property name='format' value='Unformatted'/><property name='controlType' value='textbox'/><expression name='defaultValue'>55/66/9999</expression></scalar parameter></parameters>. There are two problems with this scenario:
EB: First, the model should have stored a dateTime type constant using the XML schema date/time format (yyyymmddThh:mm:ss, see http://www.w3.org/TR/xmlschema2/), which is locale-independent, to ensure portability. Second, the date value should have been validated by the UI or Model.
SR:
To reproduce the issue: 
1. Open the BIRT report designer.
2. Create a new report parameter with the type 'DateTime'.
3. In the 'default value' field, enter an invalid date string, such as '55/66/9999'.
4. Verify that the invalid value is accepted and that the report design shows the incorrect definition as mentioned in the observed behavior.

Note: Make sure to use an invalid date string that does not conform to a universal format or the system default locale format.
